newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Telebras surges on rate rise.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Telebras surges on rate rise.

text.p: Brazilian state-owned telecommunications firm Telebras surged Friday following an increase in telephone rates, highlighting trade in American Depositary Receipts ADRs.
Traders said most European ADRs were fairly firm despite weakness in the bond market triggered by U.S. March employment and wage figures.
"After a bumpy start the market is really, really trying to rally," a trader said. "It looks as if it might turn up today, but it's under pressure from bonds."

Telebras jumped 4-1/4 to a 12-month high of 113 after the Brazilian government approved the long-awaited rate increase, which will lead to a 3.1 percent net increase in revenues for telecom operators.
Volume was heavy, with one million Telebras shares changing hands in the first hour of trading. It was among the most active issues on the New York Stock Exchange.
"Telebras really is the feature of the day," a trader said.
Fellow Latin American telecom Telefonos de Mexico was unchanged at 39-1/4.
Canadian drugs company BioChem Pharma Inc rose 3-1/8 to 46-1/8 after Vertex Pharmaceuticals Inc said it and BioChem had started Phase II clinical trials of a breast cancer treatment.
Among other active issues, Singapore software company Creative Technology Ltd rose 1-1/8 to 11-7/8, and troubled Canadian gold mining company Bre-X Minerals Ltd fell 1/8 to 2-1/2.
Decliners led advancers by 210 to 131 among 806 ADRs in early-morning trade. The ADR index was up 0.03 percent.
